tests.title: If present (proof), its value MUST be either a single object, or an unordered set of objects.

tests.title: ("proof.id") An optional identifier for the proof, which MUST be a URL.

cell.rowId: ("proof.id") An optional identifier for the proof, which MUST be a URL.

tests.title: The specific type of proof MUST be specified as a string that maps to a URL.

cell.rowId: The specific type of proof MUST be specified as a string that maps to a URL.

tests.title: The type property MUST contain the string DataIntegrityProof.

cell.rowId: The type property MUST contain the string DataIntegrityProof.

tests.title: The proofValue property MUST be used, as specified in 2.1 Proofs.

cell.rowId: The proofValue property MUST be used, as specified in 2.1 Proofs.

tests.title: If the proof type is DataIntegrityProof, cryptosuite MUST be specified; otherwise, cryptosuite MAY be specified.

tests.title: If specified (proof.cryptosuite), its value MUST be a string.

tests.title: A verification method is the means and information needed to verify the proof. If included, the value MUST be a string that maps to a [URL].

tests.title: The reason the proof was created ("proof.proofPurpose") MUST be specified as a string that maps to a URL.

cell.rowId: The reason the proof was created ("proof.proofPurpose") MUST be specified as a string that maps to a URL.

tests.title: ("proof.proofValue") A string value that expresses base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified. The value MUST use a header and encoding as described in Section 2.4 Multibase of the Controller Documents 1.0 specification to express the binary data.

cell.rowId: ("proof.proofValue") A string value that expresses base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified. tests.title: Conforming processors MUST produce errors when non-conforming documents are consumed.

tests.title: If the "proof" field is missing, an error MUST be raised.

tests.title: If the "proof" field is invalid, an error MUST be raised.

cell.rowId: If the "proof" field is invalid, an error MUST be raised.

tests.title: If the "proof.type" field is missing, an error MUST be raised.

tests.title: If the "proof.type" field is not the string "DataIntegrityProof", an error MUST be raised.

cell.rowId: If the "proof.type" field is not the string "DataIntegrityProof", an error MUST be raised.

tests.title: If the "proof.verificationMethod" field is missing, an error MUST be raised.

tests.title: If expectedProofPurpose was given, and it does not match proof.proofPurpose, an error MUST be raised and SHOULD convey an error type of PROOF_VERIFICATION_ERROR.

cell.rowId: If expectedProofPurpose was given, and it does not match proof.proofPurpose, an error MUST be raised and SHOULD convey an error type of PROOF_VERIFICATION_ERROR.

tests.title: The proofValue property MUST be used, as specified in 2.1 Proofs.

cell.rowId: The proofValue property MUST be used, as specified in 2.1 Proofs.

tests.title: ("proof.proofValue") A string value that contains the base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified. The contents of the value MUST be expressed with a header and encoding as described in Section 2.4 Multibase of the Controller Documents 1.0 specification.

cell.rowId: ("proof.proofValue") A string value that contains the base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified. The contents of the value MUST be expressed with a header and encoding as described in Section 2.4 Multibase of the Controller Documents 1.0 specification.

tests.title: Implementations that use JSON-LD processing, such as RDF Dataset Canonicalization [RDF-CANON], MUST throw an error, which SHOULD be DATA_LOSS_DETECTION_ERROR, when data is dropped by a JSON-LD processor, such as when an undefined term is detected in an input document.

cell.rowId: Implementations that use JSON-LD processing, such as RDF Dataset Canonicalization [RDF-CANON], MUST throw an error, which SHOULD be DATA_LOSS_DETECTION_ERROR, when data is dropped by a JSON-LD processor, such as when an undefined term is detected in an input document.

tests.title: The value of the cryptosuite property MUST be a string that identifies the cryptographic suite. If the processing environment supports subtypes of string, the type of the cryptosuite value MUST be the https://w3id.org/security#cryptosuiteString subtype of string.

cell.rowId: The value of the cryptosuite property MUST be a string that identifies the cryptographic suite. If the processing environment supports subtypes of string, the type of the cryptosuite value MUST be the https://w3id.org/security#cryptosuiteString subtype of string.

rows.id: ("proof.proofValue") A string value that contains the base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified.
